div.p: Resources and Information

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_testimonial et_pb_testimonial_0 clearfix et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_icon_off et_pb_testimonial_no_image

div.p:
To: Woodburn School Community
Re: Distance Learning Model Implemented

As you know we have begun to implement a Distance Learning model that connects students with teachers to provide access to grade-level learning. We know that distance learning will not replace the opportunity to be together at school, but we will do our best to provide the elements of care, connection, and continuity of learning that we all need during this time.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_toggle et_pb_toggle_0 et_animated et_pb_toggle_item et_pb_toggle_close

div.p: Distance Learning simply refers to learning that occurs when educators and students are in different places. It can take many forms. We will use strategies that best serve and provide access to our students and families. Until yesterday, Oregon public schools were given direction to provide only short-term, non-graded, supplemental learning. As it has become more likely that students will not return to school buildings this year the direction from the state is to now plan for implementing, a more standards-based, graded, and potentially credit-bearing distance education for all students. Teachers will determine which essential grade-level standards need to be taught and learned, and how to best deliver instruction that supports all students with accessing the instruction and demonstrating their proficiency. Know that guidance is still being developed by ODE for graduation and earning credit for our high school students.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_toggle et_pb_toggle_1 et_animated et_pb_toggle_item et_pb_toggle_close
et_pb_module et_pb_toggle et_pb_toggle_2 et_animated et_pb_toggle_item et_pb_toggle_close

div.p: Grab-and-Go Meals will be available for Woodburn residents between the ages of 1 – 18.
Meals will be available at designated locations from Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. – 12 p.m.
The locations are Washington Elementary, French Prairie Middle School, and Nuevo Amanecer.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_toggle et_pb_toggle_3 et_animated et_pb_toggle_item et_pb_toggle_close

p.strong: The Governor’s Stay Home, Save Lives Executive Order and Essential Services

div.p: The Stay Home-Save Lives order issued by the Governor on Monday does not significantly impact the essential services that are provided by the Woodburn School District. Our curbside, grab-and-go breakfast and lunch programs will continue. Breakfast and lunch are available to all children aged 1-18. Currently, meals are available at Washington Elementary School, Nuevo Amanacer, and French Prairie Middle/Lincoln Elementary School. Beginning on March 30th we will expand services to Nellie Muir Elementary School, and Valor Middle/Heritage Elementary School. Meals will be available for pickup from 9AM-12PM and please remember children must be present. It is also very important that everyone maintain safe social distance during pick up.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_toggle et_pb_toggle_4 et_animated et_pb_toggle_item et_pb_toggle_close
div.h5: High-risk for severe illness from COVID-19

div.p: Based on what we know now, those at high-risk for severe illness from COVID-19 are:

ul.li: People who live in a nursing home or long-term care facility

div.p: People of all ages with underlying medical conditions, particularly if not well controlled, including:

ul.li: People with chronic lung disease or moderate to severe asthma
People who have serious heart conditions

People who are immunocompromised
Many conditions can cause a person to be immunocompromised, including cancer treatment, smoking, bone marrow or organ transplantation, immune deficiencies, poorly controlled HIV or AIDS, and prolonged use of corticosteroids and other immune weakening medications
People with severe obesity (body mass index [BMI] of 40 or higher)
People with chronic kidney disease undergoing dialysis

div.p: Resource: CDC

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_slider et_pb_slider_0 et_animated et_hover_enabled et_pb_slider_fullwidth_off et_slider_auto et_slider_speed_5000

h2.a: WSD "In-Person" Classes Closed for the Remainder of the School Year

div.div:
Woodburn School District compiled strategies and educational activities that families can use to keep students engaged in learning in the event of a school closure. Remote learning activities are organized by grade level and contain options across multiple subject areas, including consideration for student physical and mental wellness. Our goal is to provide a structure for at-home learning, so families have some activities to prevent regression and learning loss during an extended break. At this time, there is no expectation that teachers or parents provide extended resources, communication, or assess students during the closure. Students are not required to participate in remote learning but are encouraged to access the resources provided.
Shared Google Document
Elementary English Supplement Resources
Check back soon for more resources.

div.p: The information listed on this page is pulled directly from a document provided by WSD’s Curriculum and Instruction Department. To view the latest updates, check out the Elementary Supplemental Instruction Sharable Google Document.

Act Up! Drama for Justice: Students write and perform a skit or monologue that brings awareness to a specific issue addressed in the text.

div.p: El Distrito Escolar de Woodburn compiló estrategias y actividades educacionales que las familias pueden usar para mantener a los estudiantes involucrados con su aprendizaje en el caso que se cierren las escuelas. Las actividades de aprendizaje remoto están organizadas por nivel de grado y contienen una combinación de opciones a través de todas las áreas de contenidos incluyendo la consideración por el bienestar físico y mental de los estudiantes. Nuestro objetivo es proveer una estructura para el aprendizaje en el hogar para que las familias tengan algunas actividades para prevenir la regresión y la perdida de aprendizaje durante un receso extendido. En este momento, no hay expectativas de que los maestros o los padres provean recursos de extensión, comunicación o evaluaciones durante este cierre. No se requiere que los estudiantes participen en aprendizaje remoto pero se los alienta a acceder los recursos provistos.

Google Arts and Culture Collection: Explore algunos de los museos más famosos del mundo.
Act Up! Drama for Justice: Los estudiantes escriben y actúan un acto o monólogo que ayuda a darse cuenta de un tema problema específico tratado en el texto.

div.p: Школьный округ г.Вудбурн составил список стратегий и общеобразовательных занятий, которые могут использовать семьи для вовлечения учеников в процесс обучения во время закрытия школы. Занятия по дистанционному обучению организованы по классам и включают сайты по нескольким предметам, а также сайты, способствующие физическому и психическому здоровью учеников. Наша цель состоит в том, чтобы создать структуру для обучения на дому, чтобы в семьях шли занятия по предотвращению регресса и потери школьных навыков во время продолжительного перерыва. В настоящее время не ожидается, что учителя или родители предоставляют большое количество материалов, будут общаться или оценивать работу учеников во время закрытия школ. Ученикам не обязательно участвовать в дистанционном обучении, но мы хотим предложить им доступ к предоставляемым ресурсам.

h3.style: width: auto; border: 20px; border-color: blue; padding: 10px; margin: 10px; background-color: #1e1c5d;
width: auto; border: 20px; border-color: blue; padding: 10px; margin: 10px; background-color: #1e1c5d;

td.p: Tumble Books Предоставляет материалы для чтения уровня нулевого и первого класса. Sora: приложение для доступа к текстам в электронном и аудио формате K-12

Reading A to Z: Пробная подписка на онлайн библиотеку с текстами на разных уровняx чтения, на английском и испанском языках

p.img: Math Before Bed: K-5 задания для математических исследований и обсуждений

ABCya.com: игры по чтению и математике

td.p: Brainpop: Образовательный веб-сайт с более чем 1000 коротких анимационных фильмов, охватывающих предметы науки, общественных наук, английского языка, математики, техники и технологии, здравоохранения, искусства и музыки
Lunch Doodles with Mo Willems:
Займитесь рисованием во время обеда с автором и иллюстратором Мо Виллемсом
Funbrain.com: Поучительные игры онлайн

p.strong: Sign up to receive our latest updates in your mail box.

input.name: ctct-opt-in
input.label: Example: Yes, I would like to receive emails from WSD News. (You can unsubscribe anytime)

hr.sub: By submitting this form, you are consenting to receive marketing emails from: Woodburn School District, 1390 Meridian Drive, Woodburn , OR, 97071, http://www.woodburnsd.org. You can revoke your consent to receive emails at any time by using the SafeUnsubscribe® link, found at the bottom of every email. Emails are serviced by Constant Contact

br.br:
Woodburn School District meeting locations are accessible to persons with disabilities. A request for an interpreter for the hearing impaired, or for other accommodations for persons with disabilities, should be made at least 48 hours in advance of the meeting. Please contact Peppi Kosikowski, Assistant HR Specialist at 503-981.2713.
The Woodburn School District recognizes the diversity and worth of all individuals and groups. It is the policy of the Woodburn School District to comply with state and federal laws and promote nondiscrimination and an environment free of harassment of individuals or groups based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, marital status, age, or disability in any educational programs, activities or employment.
All Career and Technical Education (CTE) programs in this school district will be open to all students. The District will take steps to ensure that the lack of English language skills will not be a barrier to admission and participation in CTE Programs.

Dana Christie Coordinator, Title II & Section 504 (503) 981-2726 1390 Meridian Drive, Woodburn, OR 97071
Casey Woolley Coordinator, Title IX (503 ) 981-2612 1390 Meridian Drive, Woodburn, OR 97071
